intro: [WRONG START] Carduus × nutantiformus intercedens, commonly known as the intermediate sand thistle, is a hybrid plant resulting from the cross between Carduus nutans and Carduus arenarius. It is a perennial herb characterized by its spiny leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. The species is noted for its ecological adaptability and is sometimes found in disturbed areas or along roadsides.
